body_html:
@nectario for windows please file a separate issue, that will need to be addressed separately.
@alyato, when you are installing cuDNN, the simplest way (AFAICR the way recommended in NVIDIA cuDNN website) is to just do this:

cd ~
sudo tar xvf cudnn-7.5-linux-x64-v5.0.tgz
sudo cp -R cuda /usr/local
export LB_LIBRARY_PATH=${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/cuda/lib

If you do the above, it should just work with configure script.
This issue is about the problems we see when we have cuDNN installed using the deb packages distributed by NVIDIA.

@alyato, when you are installing cuDNN, the simplest way (AFAICR the way recommended in NVIDIA cuDNN website) is to just do this:
```
cd ~
sudo tar xvf cudnn-7.5-linux-x64-v5.0.tgz
sudo cp -R cuda /usr/local
export LB_LIBRARY_PATH=${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/cuda/lib
```
If you do the above, it should just work with configure script.
This issue is about the problems we see when we have cuDNN installed using the deb packages distributed by NVIDIA.
